intro: Psephellus sumensis, commonly known as the Sumatra sandwort, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in the tropical regions of Indonesia. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its botanical features include a low-growing habit, with hairy stems and clustered inflorescences. Despite its ornamental appeal, it is not widely cultivated outside its natural habitat.
